bibl.title: Shrek v. Berry. Commitment Upon Sentence

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF WASHINGTON TERRITORY AND FOR THE FIRST JUDICIAL DISTRICT THEREOF HOLDING TERMS AT COLFAX IN WHITMAN COUNTY IN SAID TERRITORY.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION # OF Michael SHREK FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS # CORPUS. #
Your petitioner respectfully represents that he is restrained of his liberty by L. P. Berry , Sheriff of Whitman County, in the County Jail, at Colfax, in said Whitman County, Washington Territory.

That the cause of said restraint, to the best of affiant's knowledge and belief is, that he is restrained by said L.P. Berry, by virture of a certain warrant of commitment issuing out of hte justice court of Whitman County, Washington Territory, in default of petitioner to give bail to keep the peace.

That the illegality of said restraint consists in this, that the Jail,where your petitioner is restrained and confined is an unhealthy and unwholesome place and the cells and rooms where he is confined are damp, dark, unwholesome and unhealthy and have no ventilation; that by reason of the condition ofsaid Jail, as aforesaid he has contracted disease, which has compelled him to be under the care of Physicians during nearly all the time of his confinement; that said Jail now is and for a long time has been an unfit place to confine or restrain a person, by reason of its unhealthy condition as aforesaid.
Wherefore your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus be granted ot enquire in the cause of the restraint of your petitioner in said Jail.
